channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023080555
item.description:
Report X-2023080555

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat discovered on the inbound. someone placed it in a lined tote and brought it to the damage area, where they placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap. all have stained labels. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023080144
item.description:
Report X-2023080144

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-09
  • City: SAINT PAUL
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the unload lying on its side after opening a trailer. DescribePack: One of the caps on one of the bottles ended up coming loose resulting in some loss of product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in tote and chemical was watered down and absorbed to clean to spill.

item.title: Report X-2023080118
item.description:
Report X-2023080118

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was discovered this morning on the inbound and was removed from the van, then brought to the damage area. someone placed a code 39 on the package with a note, "pending inspection." HESS specialist began to work on the package and discovered that it was an undeclared hazmat, placing it in a lined tote and moving it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023070505
item.description:
Report X-2023070505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, BY THE RESPONDER. IN THE DMP, PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND FOUND TO CONTAIN, ONE GLASS JUG OF, XYLENES REAGENT (ACS), BEING SHIPPED AS A FLAMMABLE HAZ-MAT PACKAGE, (UN1307, XYLENES, 3, II 1 FIBERBOARD BOX X 4 L). UPON INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED GLASS JUG SHATTERD INSIDE ITS CARTON. ALL LIQUID WAS ABSORBED AND ALL PACKING MATER WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP ACCORDING TO REGULATIONS.

item.title: Report X-2023070354
item.description:
Report X-2023070354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: South St Paul
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Citizen adjacent to yard reported faint ammonia odor coming from the yard. Fire department responded to area to begin investigation. Hazardous Material Emergency Response Manager and contractor support Rybak Environmental, llc. inspected yard and found the PROX 30244 releasing from the vapor valve being open and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed by response team and plug tightened tool tight. Car was secured then released back to transportation.

item.title: Report X-2023070344

Report X-2023070344

  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTICED A STRONG SMELL FROM THE PACKAGE AND TOLD THE RESPONDER. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE. ALL FOUR CONTAINERS ARE BEING DISPOSED OF VIA THE DMP BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2023070343
item.description:
Report X-2023070343

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTICED A STRONG SMELL FROM THE PACKAGE AND TOLD THE RESPONDER. RESPONDER RESPONDED AND DISCOVERED THE CAP ON ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE. THE CONTAINERS WERE VENTED CAPS, AND CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM, ALL FOUR CONTAINERS DISPOSED OF VIA THE DMP BY RESPONDER.

DescribePack: small pin like crack on the bottom of the drum DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: put into a salvage drum right away, and was able to contain without any liquid leaving drum

item.title: Report E-2023070940
item.description:
Report E-2023070940

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: FRIDLEY
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drum of methanol (un1230) releasing 55 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
